1. Navigate into the chosen location: `cd /path/to/your/chosen/directory`
**Tip**: A good location might be within your "Documents" folder or a dedicated "Projects" or "University" folder.
This ensures that your course-related files are organized and easily accessible.
1. Use the command line to display the path of your chosen directory using `pwd`
1. Within your chosen folder, create a new subfolder and name it `recipes`: `mkdir recipes`
1. Navigate into the `recipes` folder: `cd recipes`
1. Create a new file and name it `recipes.txt`: `touch recipes.txt`
1. Confirm the creation of the file by listing the contents of the `recipes` folder: `ls`
